comments.body: linking to `current` instead of `$version$` might be debatable, but I like it! Looks like we only publish scaladoc, not javadoc? Added #629.
I tried to use `$version$`, but Paradox does not resolve properties within URLs.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +7,11 @@The code in this documentation is compiled against

* Alpakka $version$ ([Github](https://github.com/akka/alpakka), [API docs](https://developer.lightbend.com/docs/api/alpakka/current/akka/stream/alpakka/index.html))
* Scala $scalaBinaryVersion$
* Akka Streams $akkaVersion$ (@extref[API docs Scala](akka-docs:scala/stream/index.html), @extref[API docs Java](akka-docs:java/stream/index.html), [Github](https://github.com/akka/akka))

@@ -1,1 +9,13 @@* Alpakka $version$ ([Github](https://github.com/akka/alpakka), [API docs](https://developer.lightbend.com/docs/api/alpakka/current/akka/stream/alpakka/index.html))
* Scala $scalaBinaryVersion$
* Akka Streams $akkaVersion$ (@extref[API docs Scala](akka-docs:scala/stream/index.html), @extref[API docs Java](akka-docs:java/stream/index.html), [Github](https://github.com/akka/akka))
* Akka Http $akkaHttpVersion$ (@extref[API docs Scala](akka-http-docs:scala.html), @extref[API docs Java](akka-http-docs:java.html), [Github](https://github.com/akka/akka-http))

comments.body: We shouldn't use "connectors" because it will also contain transformation stages?

I see Alpakka as containing connectors, integration patterns, and data transformations.
That's why I tried to find a more general word here
Why not an exhaustive list of component type? it's bits longer, but clearer

@harksin You mean something like:

Welcome to the home of the Alpakka innitiative, which harbours various Akka Streams connectors, integration patters, and data transformations for integration use cases.
